Crimes.Legal_Issue: Availability of state protection in country of origin
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; focus on evidence ignored
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony and documentary evidence of similarly situated individuals
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA – Convention refugee definition
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Perceived homosexuality leading to fear of persecution
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Evidence of lack of state protection for LGBTQ+ individuals
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider relevant evidence of similarly situated person
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision set aside and remanded to new panel
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Case of Michael, a gay man denied police protection in St. Vincent
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Adequacy and effectiveness of state protection
Crimes.Application_Factor: Cultural attitudes toward homosexuality in St. Vincent
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Did the Board err in finding state protection available?
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA, s. 97(1); international refugee law principles
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Presumption of effective state protection despite contrary evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Board failed to address specific evidence of unavailability of protection
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Deficient due to failure to engage with key evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not central; applicant’s testimony largely accepted
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Board's conclusion
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to assess individualized risk and state protection
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to analyze evidence of similarly situated persons
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: None found; claim based on persecution risk

Crimes.Perpetrator_Type: Private actors (potential attackers due to sexual orientation)
Crimes.Threat_Source: Societal and potential state actor indifference
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Existence of formal legal protections in democratic state
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – risk of physical and sexual violence
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient – supported by personal testimony and third-party case (Michael)
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, country condition reports, analogous case evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Accepted as credible by the Court
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant deemed credible; Board did not challenge truthfulness
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk of targeted victimization due to perceived homosexuality
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – based on imputed sexual orientation
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law, Canadian immigration law
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Definition of Convention refugee under IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to properly assess availability of state protection
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee appeal and judicial review process
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under Rule 328 of the Federal Courts Rules

Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Threats to life and safety based on sexual orientation
Crimes.Perpetrator_Type: Private actors and potential state complicity through inaction
Crimes.Threat_Source: Community-based violence and lack of police intervention
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: History of anti-LGBTQ+ sentiment and violence
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Formal democratic institutions and rule of law
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – threat to life and physical integrity
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient – supported by personal account and corroboration
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Claimant testimony, country condition evidence, case of Michael
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found credible; no adverse findings
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – due to imputed sexual orientation
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to meaningfully assess state protection

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Provide Necessities of Life
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Availability and effectiveness of state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Failure to assess evidence of ineffective state protection
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear
Crimes.Legal_Rule: State protection must be reasonably forthcoming and effective
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to perceived homosexuality
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Compromised by omission of key evidence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Case of Michael who was denied police protection
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA and jurisprudence on state protection
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Board relied on general country conditions without individualized assessment
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Referral to new panel for hearing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk of persecution based on sexual orientation
Crimes.Governing_Rule: State protection must be effective and accessible
